title: Lyft Shares Plunge on Weak Earnings Outlook
sub_head: Ride-hailing company says it will invest to attract drivers, prepare platform for future growth
body:
Lyft Inc. said it would invest in the current quarter to ensure adequate driver supply and grow its ride-hailing platform, spooking investors as the spending weighs on operating profit.
The ride-hailing company on Tuesday forecast adjusted earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortization, its preferred metric of financial performance, of $10 million to $20 million. The figure represents a second sequential quarterly decline and missed Wall Street expectations by more than $50 million.
